title: Guides | %%BRAND_NAME%%
description: Independent educational guides explaining how USCIS medical exams (Form I-693) are typically completed and verified. No rankings. No endorsements. Educational only.
main_html:
Educational Guides

How USCIS Medical Exams Are Typically Completed and Verified

Independent, educational frameworks explaining how USCIS medical exams (Form I-693) are typically completed, what documents matter, and what applicants commonly misunderstand. Not legal advice. No endorsements or rankings.

If you only read one thing: These guides explain process flow and document readiness — not whether you should choose any specific civil surgeon.

%%AD:global_guides_top%%

How to Use These Guides

Each guide walks through a key part of the I-693 process: what to bring, what to ask, typical timeframes and costs, and what to do after the exam. Start with the guide that matches where you are in the process.

Quick Routing Map

  • Not sure where to start: USCIS Medical Exam Overview
  • Requirements: I-693 Medical Exam Requirements
  • Vaccines: USCIS Vaccination Requirements
  • What to bring: Document Checklist
  • Costs and timing: Costs and Timeframes
  • Choosing a civil surgeon: Questions to Ask a Civil Surgeon
  • After the exam: After Your Exam — Next Steps
  • Big picture prep: USCIS Fees, Timelines, and What to Ask

All Guides
